data.title: Seat Covers: Imperial INC (Bangalore)
meta_keywords: Team-BHP TeamBHP Indian car forum indian car community automotive forum cars indian car website automotive scene india
data.meta_description: Do these guys or anyone else in Bangalore do fabric seat covers? I'm interested in getting a material very similar to the OEM fabric (like you do on any sub 10l hatchback).
data.text:
BHPian

Join Date: Jun 2015

Location: Bangalore

Posts: 417

Thanked: 1,850 Times

Re: Seat Covers: Imperial INC (Bangalore)

Folks, I had got Art leather seat covers from Imperial Leathers in July 2015.

I am here to report that after 3 years of daily usage, the seat covers have held up really well.

Not a single stitch has come out, no damage to the outer layer, no fading, tight and snug fit as day 1.

It has turned out to be a very wise decision, though I had to commute from Whitefield, definitely worth the effort.

Every time I give the car for service, I am asked by the SA, where did I get the seat covers from.

I have recommended the shop to a few colleagues as well.

The quailty to price ratio has left me impressed. Also, the professionalism of the owner, Shiv is praiseworthy.

PS - I am in no way associated with Imperial Leathers. I am a very satisfied customer.

Distinguished - BHPian

Join Date: Nov 2007

Location: Belur/Bangalore

Posts: 7,148

Thanked: 27,157 Times

Re: Seat Covers: Imperial INC (Bangalore)

Quote:

Originally Posted by deehunk

Visit Car Shringar on JC Road, Bangalore, they stock "Elegant" brand fabric seat covers for most of the popular hatchbacks and Sedans. I have purchased seat covers from them for many of my previous cars, they sell genuine products.

Would vouch for Elegant when it comes to Fabric seat covers and also Fabric floor mats.

They are indeed of good quality as I can see it in one of my cars that has lasted beyond a decade now. Even when I was searching for Elegant seat covers for a friend's Manza last year, Car Shringar was one (or the only one) authorized seller of Elegant products as per their website.

Distinguished - BHPian

Location: Speed-brkr City

Posts: 15,979

Thanked: 16,251 Times

Re: Seat Covers: Imperial INC (Bangalore)

Quote:

Originally Posted by McLaren Rulez

Do these guys or anyone else in Bangalore do fabric seat covers? I'm interested in getting a material very similar to the OEM fabric (like you do on any sub 10l hatchback).

+1 to the point by Parag. I have Elegant seat covers in my Storme, 5 years now.

You can check the designs on their website Elegantauto.in. Many accessories shops here have samples. If you select a design, you could even ask the accessories shops in Mys to get it for you ( they are manufactured in their Uttrakhand factory. Only the fitting is here).

Re: Seat Covers: Imperial INC (Bangalore)

Quote:

Originally Posted by cool_dube

Hello all,

I need to get good quality steering cover (leather) for 2 of my cars. Any recommendations around east Bangalore area (Whitefield, Marathahalli, Indiaranagar)?

Thanks in advance...

Please do visit J.C Road on the weekend and get it done by Devaraj, got mine done from there and it feels good every time I drive my car. The quality of work is worth the time you would need to travel there.

Hi,

I want to get seat covers for my I20 and this looks like a good option. One question though, how to they fit the seat covers?many makers glue it to the seat or put a stitching in the seat to hold the seat cover. I am strictly against any sort of damage or alteration to the OEM seats.

Last edited by adutta2k : 4th November 2018 at 16:14.

Distinguished - BHPian

Join Date: Oct 2013

Location: Bangalore

Posts: 1,817

Thanked: 5,573 Times

Re: Seat Covers: Imperial INC (Bangalore)

Quote:

Originally Posted by drive2eternity

The quailty to price ratio has left me impressed. Also, the professionalism of the owner, Shiv is praiseworthy.

Ditto. My TUV seat covers still look great and apart from some very minute fraying at the edge of the driver seat, everything else is fabulous. Even the steering grip feels very good and its been almost 3 years.

Quote:

Originally Posted by adutta2k

strictly against any sort of damage or alteration to the OEM seats.

I would suggest you stay away from imperial in that case. Please check this post for more details of the process. They strip away the OEM cover and only then "suit up" your seats. They dont use anything to piece or damage the seats as the covers are all tight fit and only need minimal stitching/pinching from the outside. Would suggest you talk to shiva, go there and take a look at how it's done before you invest.

Disclaimer: not in any way associated with Imperial leathers.
